result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittany N Bell

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing January 1, 2023.

8:25 AM Defendant Brittany N Bell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant states she has continued to be in contact with private counsel but has not received a response back. The defendant further states she attempted to contact the Public Defender's Office but the phone continues to ring. The Court reviews the defendant's income and finances on the record to get this case moving. Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing January 1, 2023. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing. The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next appearance.
Hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:30 AM Defendant Brittany N Bell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court notes the defendant did request a preliminary hearing be set within 20 days and she would have an attorney present today.  Defendant states she did pay a partial payment to attorney Carter but has not heard back from him.  
The State did have an officer present in Court today.  Attorney Will does not have an objection to adjourning this matter but requests a status of counsel date prior to setting another preliminary hearing.
Defendant states she is willing to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  
Preliminary time limits waived. 
Court sets a date for status of counsel.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Letter from Defendant requesting adjournment on Prelim**Reviewed by Commissioner Daniel Rieck on 10/14 "Adjournment request is denied. Failure to appear may result in the issuance of an arrest warrant"

10:03 AM Defendant Brittany N Bell in court.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
The Defendant states she has been contact with a lawyer and requests a prelim hearing date to have her lawyer present.
PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Brittany N Bell in court.  Attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for State of Wisconsin. The defendant is asking for additional time to retain private counsel. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens/witness A or B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:44 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Brittany N Bell in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. 
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion Order to Seal Victim Identification Key, Signed by Judge Carter on 08/15/2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
